text: Local marketing pro joins KC agency in new executive role Feb 22, 2017, 2:54pm CST Industries & Tags Leslie Collins Reporter Kansas City Business Journal Share Leslie Collins Reporter Kansas City Business Journal Related Content Jeff Randolph, vice president and director of client services for EAG Advertising &… more EAG Advertising & Marketing Spurred by growth, EAG Advertising & Marketing has created a new role: vice president and director of client services. The Kansas City-based agency tapped Jeff Randolph to fill the senior management role. Randolph previously was chief marketing officer for Overland Park-based ARMA International, an Overland Park-based nonprofit association for information management professionals, and Camp Fire USA, a Kansas City-based nonprofit youth development organization serving youth, teens and families in communities nationwide. Jeff Randolph, vice president and director of client services for EAG Advertising &… more EAG Advertising & Marketing He's also an adjunct professor with Avila University's MBA program and is president of the Kansas City chapter of the American Marketing Association. "We wanted to expand the senior-level CMO thinking that we provide to our clients," EAG President Michele Markham told the Kansas City Business Journal . It brings another high-level strategic thinker to the table, she said. In his new role, Randolph will lead the account team, provide strategic day-to-day management of accounts and help clients achieve marketing objectives. Randolph was an attractive candidate for multiple reasons, including his involvement in the local marketing community and his experience on the client and agency side with small and large brands, she said. Having Randolph on board allows EAG to pursue more clients and offer another level of expertise. The agency already is experiencing growth in its client base, including referrals and new clients in the Kansas City area. "I think the economy and the Kansas City environment are spurring the growth," Markham said. "(The companies) are moving to that next level where they actually need marketing support." EAG serves nearly 300 small and mid-market companies throughout the U.S. in industries, such as aerospace, legal services and retail. A number of its clients are second-generation businesses. Leslie covers entrepreneurs and technology, retail, and marketing. Related Content
